data.title: Walt Disney (Animator)
data.meta_description: Walt Disney was an American entrepreneur best known as a pioneer of cartoon production and the animation industry. He still holds the record, as a result of...
data.text:
Walt Disney

Profession: Animator

Biography: Walt Disney was an American entrepreneur best known as a pioneer of cartoon production and the animation industry. He still holds the record, as a result of his production work, for the most Academy Awards nominations and wins held by a single individual: 22 Oscars and 59 nominations.

Disney, who was born in 1901 Chicago, always had an interest in drawing. This led to early work as a commercial illustrator before Disney eventually moved to California and, with his brother Ron, set up the Disney Brothers Studio.

The character of Mickey Mouse was developed in 1928 with Ub Iwerks at the Disney Brothers Studio. This character was their first popular success, which led to more and more ambitious productions: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs (1937), Pinocchio (1940), Fantasia (1940), Dumbo (1941), Bambi (1942).

On the back of this success, Disney would later expand his business into amusement parks by opening Disneyland in 1955 at Anaheim, California.

Born: December 5, 1901

Birthplace: Chicago, Illinois, USA

Generation: Greatest Generation

Chinese Zodiac: Ox

Star Sign: Sagittarius

Died: December 15, 1966 (aged 65)

Historical Events

Walt Disney starts work as an artist with KC Slide Co for $40 a week

Walt Disney incorporates his 1st film company Laugh-O-Gram Films

Disney Brothers Cartoon Studio becomes Walt Disney Studios

Test footage is first created for Walt Disney's "Steamboat Willie", featuring Mickey Mouse

Walt Disney's "Steamboat Willie" released, first Mickey Mouse sound cartoon

"Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs", the first full-length animated feature film and the earliest in the Walt Disney Animated Classics series, premieres at the Carthay Circle Theatre, Los Angeles

Walt Disney's second feature length movie, "Pinocchio" premieres (NYC)

Walt Disney begins serving as an informer for the Los Angeles office of the FBI; his job is to report back information on Hollywood subversives.

Walt Disney's animated film "Fantasia", starring Leopold Stokowski, The Philadelphia Orchestra, Mickey Mouse, and ballet dancing hippopotamuses, premieres at the Broadway Theatre, New York City

Walt Disney's animated film "Dumbo" released

Walt Disney's animated film anthology "Make Mine Music" premieres in New York City

2nd Cannes Film Festival ends with six different awards presented including Best Musical for Vincente Minnelli's" Ziegfeld Follies" and Walt Disney's "Dumbo" Best Animation

Walt Disney's animated film "Cinderella" premieres in Boston. Massachusetts

Walt Disney releases animated musical film "Alice In Wonderland", featuring Kathryn Beaumont, J. Pat O'Malley, Ed Wynn, and Sterling Holloway and songs by Sammy Fain and Bob Hilliard

Walt Disney's 1st TV show, "Disneyland", premieres on ABC

Walt Disney's animated film "Lady & the Tramp" released

Walt Disney's animated film "101 Dalmatians", based on the novel by Dodie Smith and directed by Clyde Geronimi and Hamilton Luske is released in the US

Walt Disney's musical film "Mary Poppins" directed by Robert Stevenson, starring Julie Andrews and Dick Van Dyke, with songs by Richard and Robert Sherman, premieres at Grauman's Chinese Theatre in Los Angeles, California; wins 5 Academy Awards

Walt Disney awarded Medal of Freedom at White House

Personal Life

Film producer and co-founder of Walt Disney Productions Walt Disney (23) weds Lillian Bounds (26) at Lewiston's Episcopal Church of the Nativity in Lewiston, Idaho
